definitions.definition: the soft part in the mouth that moves around, used for tasting, swallowing, speaking, etc.

examples.text: He clicked his tongue to attract their attention.
She ran her tongue over her lips.
It's very rude to stick your tongue out at people.
The dog lay in a patch of shade with its tongue hanging out.
The snake's tongue flicked out of its mouth.

phrases: be on the tip of your tongue

definitions.definition: the tongue of some animals, cooked and eaten

examples.text: a slice of ox tongue

phrases: be on the tip of your tongue

definitions.definition: a language

examples.text: Even when we speak the same tongue we do not always understand one another.
I tried speaking to her in her native tongue.
The market place was full of people speaking many strange tongues.
She could hear men whispering in a foreign tongue.
She speaks English and Danish, though her native tongue is German.

definitions.definition: a particular way of speaking

examples.text: He has a sharp tongue.
I'll thank you to **keep a civil tongue in your head** *(= speak politely)*.

phrases: be on the tip of your tongue

definitions.definition: speaking in the way mentioned

examples.text: sharp-tongued

definitions.definition: a long, narrow piece of leather under the laces on a shoe
something that is long and narrow and like a tongue in shape

examples.text: a tongue of flame

definitions.definition: to stop yourself from saying something that might upset somebody or cause an argument, although you want to speak

examples.text: I didn't believe her explanation but I bit my tongue.

definitions.definition: said to somebody, especially a child, who stays silent when expected to speak, for example after being asked a question

examples.text: What's the matter? Cat got your tongue?

definitions.definition: to be able to speak or express your opinion
to pronounce a difficult word correctly

examples.text: He was having trouble getting his tongue around my name.

definitions.definition: to talk too much, especially about things that are private
to say nothing although you would like to give your opinion
to make somebody talk more freely than usual

examples.text: A bottle of wine had loosened Harry's tongue.

definitions.definition: if a word or name is on the tip of your tongue, you are sure that you know it but you cannot remember it
to be easy to say or pronounce

examples.text: It's not a name that exactly trips off the tongue, is it?

definitions.definition: to cause people to start talking/people are talking about somebody’s private affairs

examples.text: His sudden resignation set tongues wagging.
This is a small island and tongues are beginning to wag.

definitions.definition: a small mistake in something that you write or say

examples.text: Did I call you Richard? Sorry, Robert, just a slip of the tongue.
I didn't mean to say that—it was just a slip of the tongue.

definitions.definition: to be careful what you say in order not to offend somebody or make them angry
if you say something with your tongue in your cheek, you are not being serious and mean it as a joke

wordOrigin: Old English tunge, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tong, German Zunge, and Latin lingua.
